children.name: Signature Gear
children.notes: For equipment normally bought with money, each point gives goods worth up to 50% of the average campaign starting wealth (but never cash).

children.name: Versatile

features.situation: on any task that requires creativity or invention, including most rolls against Artist skill and all Engineer rolls for new inventions

children.notes: +1 bonus on any task that requires creativity or invention, including most rolls against Artist skill, all Engineer rolls for new inventions, and all skill rolls made to use the Gadgeteer advantage.

advantages.name: 3 - A total of 20 additional points in Advantages from the following list:

features.situation: to rolls for any lengthy mental task you concentrate on to the exclusion of other activities, if the GM feels such focus would be beneficial
to all rolls to notice interruptions while obsessed with a task

children.name: Wealth - Choose a level - Wealthy, Comfortable Wealth, Very Wealthy

advantages.name: 4 - A total of -30 points in Disadvantages from the following list:

children.name: Absent-Mindedness

features.situation: to all IQ and IQ-based skill rolls, save those for the task you are currently concentrating on

children.notes: Once adrift in your own thoughts, you must roll against Perception-5 in order to notice any event short of personal physical injury

children.name: Bad Sight - Near Sighted or Far Sighted

features.situation: to Vision rolls to spot items within 1 yd
to DX for any close manual task, including close combat

children.name: Bad Sight (Nearsighted)

features.situation: to Vision rolls to spot items more than 1 yd away

children.notes: Double actual distance to the target when calculating the range modifier for ranged attacks

features.situation: from past victims and anyone with Empathy
to Interrogation and Intimidation rolls when you use threats or torture

children.name: Code of Honor (Professional)
children.notes: Adhere to the ethics of your profession; always do your job to the best of your ability; support your guild, union, or professional association.

children.name: Curious
children.notes: Make a self-control roll when presented with an interesting item or situation

modifiers.name: Mild
modifiers.notes: GM secretly rolls 3d for the number of days between episodes

modifiers.name: Severe
modifiers.notes: GM secretly rolls 2d-1 for the number of days between episodes

features.situation: from others in any situation where No Sense of Humor becomes evident
to resist Influence skills: Diplomacy, Fast-Talk, Intimidation, Savoir-Faire, Sex Appeal, and Streetwise

children.name: Overconfidence

features.situation: from young or naive individuals who believe you are as good as you say you are

children.notes: You must make a self-control roll any time the GM feels you show an unreasonable degree of caution. If you fail, you must go ahead as though you were able to handle the situation!

children.name: Truthfulness
children.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you must keep silent about an uncomfortable truth (lying by omission). Roll at -5 if you actually have to tell a falsehood! If you fail, you blurt out the truth, or stumble so much that your lie is obvious.

skills.name: 5 - Two Wildcard Skills from the following list:
7 - Choose one of the Skills on the following list:
8 - Choose three of the Skills on the following list:

notes.text: 500 points - You’re a classic comic-book style inventive genius. You can come up with amazing new devices on the spot with minimal supplies; you make theoretical breakthroughs as casually as lesser engineers do arithmetic. Most of your creations are breadboard rigs that work only as long as the plot requires, but you also have a collection of durable equipment that you use for routine adventuring purposes, bought as Signature Gear.
